subject: Investing
title: How Bond Yields Work
description: A quick, practical guide to How Bond Yields Work.

hook.text: A bond pays a 5% coupon. But you bought it at a discount for $900. Your actual return is higher than 5%.

buildup.text: Yield is the real return you earn, accounting for the price you paid. It's not the same as the coupon rate.

discovery.text: Current yield divides annual interest by market price. Yield to maturity includes price changes over the bond's life.

twist.text: When bond prices go up, yields go down. When prices drop, yields rise. They always move in opposite directions.

climax.text: The 10-year Treasury yield is the most watched number in finance. Mortgages, car loans, and stocks all react to it.

punchline.text: Yield is the number that matters. Coupon is just the label on the box.

quiz.question: What happens to bond yields when bond prices rise?
